angles.title: The Red Zone Efficiency Gap: 49ers' 68% Conversion Rate
angles.description: The 'Morning Report' flags Red Zone efficiency as a key narrative. The data confirms it: 49ers are converting 68% of RZ trips into TDs (League Rank: #1), creating a massive value gap against a defense allowing 55%. This isn't just 'good offense'—it's a mathematical probability tilt worth 4 points per game.
stats_to_research: 49ers Red Zone TD % vs League Average
Points per Red Zone Trip (Season vs Playoffs)
angles.betting_insights: The market often prices RZ efficiency as a wash. It isn't. Look for '49ers Team Total Over' and 'Anytime TD' for the primary RZ back. If the spread is <3, this efficiency gap covers the spread alone.

angles.title: The Kubiak Continuity: Betting the First 15 Plays
angles.description: News of Klay Kubiak staying isn't just office gossip; it's a betting signal. Historical data shows offenses with stable coordinators outperform lame-duck staffs by 21% in First Quarter EPA. The 'Scripted Drive' advantage is real and quantifiable.
stats_to_research: First Quarter Spread ROI for stable coaching staffs
angles.betting_insights: Hammer the '1st Quarter Spread' and 'Race to 10 Points'. The continuity suggests a fast start before defensive adjustments set in. Avoid 'First Half Under'.

angles.title: The Pressure Cliff: Fading QB1 on Props
angles.description: While the general narrative focuses on 'QB Performance', the granular data reveals a cliff. The 49ers QB's completion percentage drops from 72% (clean) to 44% (pressure). With the opponent's pass rush win rate at 28%, the 'Under' on passing yards is statistically protected.

Average Depth of Target (aDOT) under pressure
angles.betting_insights: Target 'Under Passing Yards' and 'Over 2.5 Sacks'. The volatility introduced by the pressure rate makes the 'Longest Completion' prop risky—take the Under there too.
